page.title: 04The Town Leat-NE.of Tiverton
page.content: There is a stream called the Town Leat which runs through Allers Wood and Chettiscombe into the centre of Tiverton.This stream was given to the people of Tiverton by the Countess Isabella of Devon in 1250.The Countess wanted the people of Tiverton to have running water and the stream also filled the moat around Tiverton Castle. All those years ago people were appointed to patrol the streets to make sure that the water kept flowing.This custom still continues today. Every seven years the {"Perambulation of the Leat"}takes place when people from Tiverton walk along the course of the Leat. 'Pioneers' lead the way carrying tools to clear the Leat. The last Perambulation was in 1983.
